      • getConstrainingCondition

        public Expression getConstrainingCondition()
        Description copied from interface: ExpressionAndSyntacticContext
        The constraining condition that a parent expression imposes on its sub-expression in this context. For example, the expression: 
         if A = B then 1 else 2
 
 imposes the condition 'A = B' on the then branch sub-expression '1' 
 and 'not(A = B)' on the else branch sub-expression '2'.
        Specified by:
        getConstrainingCondition in interface ExpressionAndSyntacticContext
        Returns:
        if no constraining condition specified should return 'true' otherwise an expression representing the condition that the parent expression imposes on the sub-expression in this context.
